comments.author: batang_bitcoin
comments.body: If you see a 15% annual profits for your deposits of stable coins, that would be the highest that I've seen. comments.body: If you found it interesting, then firstly try to explain the scheme in which those numbers of interest are possible or expected.How can you be sure that the number is correctly suggested, where the profit comes from, and how does the money of investors get circulated?Do note and be in mind about the stories of Celcius and UST, and how they promised and promote about the interest that the investors could get. As a matter of fact, those kinds of platform is ceased, and proven unsustainable.

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: You have to check the track record of the platform with such offer, especially on stablecoins, the highest i have seen from a legit platform is around 10% per annum, except for terra ust which offers 20% back then but that is history now. Nowadays, most platforms use this high return of investment method to lure investors to their platform initially as stated by @batan_bitcoin but as more people join the percentage will be dropped. So don't expect it to continue this high.If you want, you can take it but it will most likely be for short term.

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: Smells fishy for a so-called legit crypto bank offering 15% per annum interest using stablecoins. It seems like a Ponzi scheme trying to prolong the period of survival in the hope of reaching the next halving and earning huge profit out of it. But they can easily close the company and declare bankruptcy. It is better if you should just buy your own preferred coins and then hold them yourself.The biggest per annum interest rate I can see at the moment from a registered bank is around 4%. And this is insured at a limit of around $10,000.
